msContents.summary: A modern, illuminated Nepalese paper manuscript of the Aparimitāyurdhāraṇīsūtra, a popular text containig the spell of Aparimitāyus. It is taught by the Buddha to Mañjuśrī in Śrāvastī. Those who recite, copy or worship this text are granted longevity and will be reborn in Aparimitāyus’ buddha-field.

msItem.title: Aparimitāyurdhāraṇīsūtra
Aparimitāyurdhāraṇīmahāyānasūtraratnarāja
Aparimitāyurnāmadhāraṇīmahāyānasūtra
Aparimitāyurnāmadhāraṇī
msItem.rubric: [1v1] $ oṃ namaḥ śrīāryyā¦[miniature]valokiteśvarāya || [1v2] ^ || oṃ namo sarvvabu[miniature]rdhhabodhisatvebhyaḥ ||
msItem.incipit: [1v2] e[1v3]vaṃ mayā śrutam ekasmi[miniature]n samaye bhagavān_ ḥ śrā[1v4]vastyāṃ viharati sma || je[miniature]tavane anāthapiṇḍada[1v5]śyārāme mahatā bhikṣu[miniature]saṃghena sārdham arddhatrayo[2r1]daśabhir bhikṣuśataiḥ saṃvahulaiś ca bodhisatvai mahāsatvaiḥ ||
msItem.explicit: [25r1] idaṃm avocad bhagavānn āttama[25r2]nās te ca, bhikṣavas te ca, bodhisatvāmahāsatvā sā ca, sarvāvati parṣasa[25r3]devamanuṣā,suragaruḍagandharvaś ca loko bhagavato bhāṣitam abhya[25r4]nandann iti || @ ||
msItem.colophon: [25r5] ye dharmmātyādi° || @ || [25v1] $ oṃ namo bhagavate, karuṇābhāsitahṛdayāya, praśamātmāsama[25v2]ye cittāya, tathā tu kamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pratiṣṭhā[25v3]panāya sugatavajatuṣyeho | oṃ āḥ kuṃ dharmmadhātu ca raśakama[25v4]lāpa arghapratiṣṭha svāhā || @ ||

supportDesc.condition: Complete, in good condition. Some folios look dirty, dump or stained.

layout.p: 5 lines per page, approximately 25 akṣaras per line.
Triple marginal frame lines in red ink; ruling in black ink.

decoNote.desc: On f. 1v, on an extra piece of Nepalese paper pasted on the space left blank for the miniature, a polichrome miniature representing the Buddha in dhyānamudrā.

item.marginalia: Running marginal title (apara or apari), top left margin, verso.

history.provenance:
Presented by Mrs. E.K. Waterhouse Waterhouse, E. K.
in 1957.
